item.title: La Petite Américaine add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I like to have a martini, Two at the very most. After three I'm under the table, after four I'm under my host." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: La Petite Américaine add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: La Petite Américaine add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I had not seen "Pride and Prejudice," till I read that sentence of yours, and then I got the book. And what did I find? An accurate daguerreotyped portrait of a common-place face; a carefully fenced, highly cultivated garden, with neat borders and delicate flowers; but no glance of a bright, vivid physiognomy, no open country, no fresh air, no blue hill, no bonny beck. I should hardly like to live with her ladies and gentlemen, in their elegant but confined houses." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: La Petite Américaine add a quote by Dorothy Parker
La Petite Américaine add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description:
"You fit into me like a hook into an eye
a fish hook an open eye" -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: La Petite Américaine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I haven't any right to criticize books, and I don't do it except when I hate them. I often want to criticize Jane Austen, but her books madden me so that I can't conceal my frenzy from the reader; and therefore I have to stop every time I begin. Every time I read Pride and Prejudice I want to dig her up and beat her over the skull with her own shin-bone." -- Mark Twain

item.title: La Petite Américaine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: La Petite Américaine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: La Petite Américaine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: La Petite Américaine add a quote by Daniel Orozco
item.description: "I read books. I know who I am." -- Daniel Orozco

item.title: La Petite Américaine add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "colleges being nothing but grooming schools for the middle-class non-identity which usually finds its perfect expression on the outskirts of the campus in rows of well-to-do houses with lawns and television sets in each living room with everybody looking at the same thing and thinking the same thing at the same time while the Japhies of the world go prowling in the wilderness to hear the voice crying in the wilderness, to find the ecstacy of the stars, to find the dark mysterious secret of the origin of faceless wonderless crapulous civilization." -- Jack Kerouac
